issue.title: Narrowing conversions between integer and integer-class types

discussion.p: The working draft ignores the possibility that:

li.p: the value of an expression of integer-class type might not be representable by the target integer type of a conversion, and
the value of an expression of integer type might not be representable by the target integer-class type of a conversion.

discussion.p:
Presumably the behavior of these cases is undefined by omission; is this actually the intent?
Notably (2) could be specified away by mandating that all integer-class types are capable of representing the value range of all integer types of the same signedness.
discussion.note: 2021-10-23 Resolved by the adoption of at the October 2021 plenary. Status changed: New → Resolved.
